content.description: Stem the dihedral for the first several clips eventually moving right and onto the face.  Giant holds on lower angle rock give way to pockets as the angle steepens.  Cool moves up through the folds build a bit of a pump to a nice rest below the final bulge.  Of course the crux awaits, guarding the anchors.  Another LP route with great pockets on bullet stone!
content.location: Right where the trail meets the cliff.  This is the left of the two routes.  It begins  by stemming the dihedral.

content.description: Good movement with some smaller holds making up the cruxy section.  Steep enough to be pumpy!
content.location: Up and around the back of the Illigitimus Rotundus.  It is just right of 40 Dayz In The Haze, back in the notch.

climbs.name: Burl Ives Is Dead
climbs.fa: Equipped by Eric (Shaggy) Johnson, 2012.  Cleaning and FA, Mike Snyder, 2013

content.description: Scamper up the crack start and onto the face.  Swim through giant grapefruit and football sized pockets until the angle tips back a bit.  Smaller jugs offer easy clipping stances and set you up for the Wild Iris-like ending up the white bulge.  Very fun with different solutions for different sized climbers.
content.location: The first route you come to when the trail finally meets the wall. Just right of Daddy Fat Sacks.  Begins in the wide crack

content.description: A very sustained route with a variety of holds, this one tends to get the forearms blazed pretty quickly.  Charlie claims 'maybe his best route of the 2012 season"
content.location: This route is in a slot around the back of this formation.  It is just right of the arete and the left of the two routes
